text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia leucolobia is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Phyllodineae that is endemic to eastern Australia.
text.Description: The shrub typically grows to a height of 3 metres (10 ft) and has a spreading habit.  patent to reflexed phyllodes that have a narrowly oblong-elliptic to lanceolate shape.
text.Distribution: It is native to an area of New South Wales from around Coolah in the north down to around Katoomba in the south and from around Bowral to Wingello as a part of open Eucalyptus woodland communities.
text.Taxonomy and naming: It was first described in 1830 by Robert Sweet. The specific epithet, leucolobia, is an adjective describing the plant as "white-podded".
